titles.title: It Is Well With My Soul (Horatio G. Stafford)

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}When peace like a river attendeth my way, When sorrows like sea billows roll, Whatever my lot, Thou has taught me to say, “It is well, it is well with my soul.”{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
v3
v4
v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}My sin, oh the bliss of this glorious thought, My sin, not in part, but in whole, Is nailed to the cross, and I bear it no more. Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord, oh my soul!{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
v7
verse.lines: {lang-eng}And, Lord, haste the day When the faith shall be sight, The clouds be rolled back as a scroll. The trump shall resound And the Lord shall descend, Even so — it is well with my soul.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v8
